page.title: 02BROMSGROVE HIGH STREET
page.content: {Bromsgrove High Street}has changed a lot in the last few years. It is now {pedestrianised}and is a lot safer and quicker to do your shopping. Vans go along the high street to deliver goods to the shops. When it wasn't pedestrianised it was very busy and very dangerous. In the centre of the high street there are two statues, one of the famous poet{A.E.Housman}and one of a dryad and a boar.{Boarsgrave}was supposed to be the name of Bromsgrove a long time ago. That is why the statue was erected. Many of the buildings in the high street are Georgian, and there are some timber-framed buildings, many of which used to be inns.
